study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the physical properties and biological effects of chitosan|genipin composites in tissue engineering, particularly for cartilage and bone regeneration, and their potential therapeutic applications.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan|genipin composites improved cell adhesion, migration, and differentiation, enhanced cartilage and bone regeneration, and demonstrated superior mechanical properties and biocompatibility. Specific outcomes included increased collagen-II and sulfated GAG production, accelerated mineral deposition, and improved viability of human adipose stem cells.
population_specificity: In vitro and in vivo models (no specific human population mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of chitosan in preventing postoperative peristomal adhesions compared to sodium hyaluronate gel and no treatment.
results_summary: Chitosan significantly reduced the severity of postoperative adhesions compared to the control group, though the incidence of adhesions did not differ significantly. No significant differences in postoperative complications or safety outcomes were observed among the groups.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing defunctioning enterostomy (114 enrolled, 87 received closure).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of chitosan-based carriers, particularly when conjugated with cell-penetrating peptides (CPPs), for improving gene delivery efficiency in gene therapy.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan's excellent biocompatibility and low cytotoxicity but notes its poor cellular uptake, which limits transfection efficiency. Conjugation with CPPs shows promise in enhancing nucleic acid delivery, particularly for plasmid DNA and small interfering RNA.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or theoretical application).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review technological advances in genipin-crosslinked chitosan hydrogels, focusing on their properties, quality assessment, and applications in medical treatments.
results_summary: GEN-chitosan hydrogels demonstrated strong antibacterial activity against Helicobacter pylori, enhanced fibroblast viability and proliferation, and supported stem cell transplantation and cartilage engineering. Advanced technologies like 3D-plotting and electrospinning improved osteocyte modulation and biomimetic scaffold development.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of chitosan (CS) and modified chitosan (Man-CS-Phe) as nonviral vectors for delivering antiviral agents (e.g., PNAs, DNA vaccines) to inhibit HBV/DHBV replication and enhance immune responses.
results_summary: The study found that modified chitosan (Man-CS-Phe) improved cellular and humoral responses to HBV DNA vaccines in mice, while CPP-modified chitosan and cationic nanoparticles enhanced plasmid DNA uptake and expression. Chitosan-based systems showed promise in preclinical models for antiviral therapy.
population_specificity: Neonatal ducklings (for DHBV inhibition) and mice (for DNA vaccine delivery).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the clinical utility of chitosan-coated garments in improving disease severity and quality of life in patients with atopic dermatitis (AD).
results_summary: Chitosan-coated textiles showed a 43.8% improvement in SCORAD (disease severity) and significantly improved Dermatology Quality of Life Index scores. The study also noted a significant increase in skin Coagulase-negative Staphylococci, suggesting a potential mechanism of action.
population_specificity: 78 adult and adolescent patients with atopic dermatitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize studies on chitosan and its derivatives (TMC, CMC, CMTMC) for accelerating wound healing, including formulation strategies and applications.
results_summary: The abstract highlights chitosan and its derivatives as beneficial for wound healing, with in vitro, in vivo, and clinical applications supporting their efficacy. Formulation strategies and specific derivatives like TMC, CMC, and CMTMC were emphasized.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on wound healing applications).

study_goal: The study aimed to review the use of hyaluronic acid (HA) and its derivatives for drug delivery and imaging, focusing on nanotheranostic systems and preclinical translation challenges.
results_summary: The abstract highlights HA's potential for intracellular delivery of imaging and anticancer agents via CD44 receptor interaction, its applications in cancer diagnosis and therapy, and its use in gene and peptide/protein drug delivery. It also notes challenges in translating preclinical HA-based models to clinical testing.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing literature).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review polysaccharide-based coatings, particularly chitosan and its derivatives, for their anti-adhesive and bactericidal properties to prevent biofilm formation on implant surfaces.
results_summary: The study highlighted chitosan's effectiveness in forming anti-adhesive and bactericidal coatings, especially when combined with other polysaccharides in layer-by-layer assemblies, demonstrating promising antibiofilm properties.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on material surfaces exposed to bacterial contamination, not human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy of nano-structured doxycycline/chitosan films as an adjunctive treatment for chronic periodontitis compared to conventional doxycycline films and placebo.
results_summary: Nano-structured doxycycline/chitosan films showed sustained drug release (23% over a week) and significantly improved clinical parameters in periodontal pockets compared to placebo and conventional doxycycline films (44% release). Clinical and biochemical evaluations confirmed the effectiveness of both nano-structured and conventional films over placebo.
population_specificity: Patients with moderate chronic periodontitis (150 periodontal pockets analyzed).
study_duration: Evaluations at baseline, 1 week, 1 month, and 2 months post-application.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate chitosan's intrinsic properties and its potential as a bioactive polymer for tissue engineering applications in regenerative medicine.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan exhibits biocompatible, biodegradable, and bioactive properties, making it a promising material for tissue engineering in repairing or regenerating various tissues such as skin, bone, cartilage, nerves, liver, and muscle. Expectations for its use are increasing as knowledge of its chemical and biological properties expands.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on tissue engineering applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of natural-origin carriers, including Chitosan, in siRNA delivery and their therapeutic potential.
results_summary: Chitosan was identified as an extensively experimented carrier for siRNA delivery, showing success alongside other polysaccharides. Modifications in carriers, including Chitosan, improved delivery efficiency.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of chitosan-insulin nanoparticles as a next-generation insulin delivery system for type-1 diabetes mellitus (T1DM).
results_summary: The study discussed chitosan-insulin nanoparticles among other nanocarrier systems for insulin delivery, highlighting their potential for oral or pulmonary administration, but did not provide specific efficacy data for chitosan alone.
population_specificity: Diabetic patients, specifically those with type-1 diabetes mellitus (T1DM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of chitosan coatings, with and without clove oil, on the quality and shelf life of cooked pork sausages under refrigerated storage.
results_summary: Chitosan coatings, especially when combined with clove oil (CS+CO), slowed the deterioration of microbiological, physical, chemical, and sensory properties in cooked pork sausages, extending shelf life compared to untreated samples. The CS+CO treatment showed the slowest degradation rates, with shelf lives of 20 days for both CS and CS+CO treatments versus 14 days for the control.
population_specificity: Cooked pork sausages stored at refrigerated temperature (4±2°C).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of chitosan and other polymeric nanocarriers in overcoming biological barriers for non-viral gene delivery.
results_summary: The abstract highlights chitosan as an important polymeric nanocarrier in gene delivery but does not provide specific results regarding its efficacy or safety. It summarizes progress in addressing biological barriers and improving gene transfer using polymeric nanocarriers.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the in vitro antibacterial activity of chitosan-stabilized silver nanoparticles against multidrug-resistant and susceptible Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.
results_summary: Chitosan-stabilized silver nanoparticles showed strong antibacterial activity, particularly against Gram-negative bacteria, with a MIC90 of 6.75 μg mL(-1). The effect was similar against both multidrug-resistant and susceptible isolates, outperforming commercial silver nanoparticles and silver controls.
population_specificity: 36 susceptible and 54 multidrug-resistant Gram-positive and Gram-negative clinical bacterial isolates.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of a gel containing chitosan (Bexident Post) in controlling post-surgical inflammation, pain, and promoting cicatrization compared to a bicarbonate oral rinse in patients undergoing molar extractions.
results_summary: Bexident Post (containing chitosan) significantly reduced pain intensity, inflammation, and analgesic pill consumption compared to bicarbonate rinse, and improved cicatrization scores. No serious side effects were reported.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing surgical removal of impacted mandibular third molars (47 patients, 22 men and 25 women, mean age 34 years).
effective_dosage: Used three times daily (specific amount not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers reviewed evidence on in situ dendritic cell (DC) vaccination for glioma treatment and proposed hypotheses for further investigation.
results_summary: The abstract discusses the potential of anti-angiogenic therapy and DC-based immunotherapy for glioma but does not provide specific findings related to Chitosan.
population_specificity: Glioma patients (not specified further).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of nanoparticles, including chitosan, in improving wound healing formulations.
results_summary: The study highlighted that chitosan, when used as an active excipient in nanomedicine, could significantly enhance the therapeutic potential of wound healing formulations. It also noted that nanoparticles embedded in secondary vehicles like dressings or hydrogels could improve application and release profiles.
population_specificity: Not specified (review paper)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of biocompatible microneedle arrays (bioMMAs), including those made with chitosan nanoparticles, as a vaccine adjuvant-delivery system (VADS) for painless vaccination via cutaneous or mucosal routes.
results_summary: The study found that bioMMAs, including those formulated with chitosan nanoparticles, effectively elicited robust systemic and mucosal immune responses when administered via skin or oral mucosa, and could be tailored to induce specific immune pathways (Th1, Th2, or mixed) depending on the adjuvants used.
population_specificity: Mammals (specific human population not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate chitosan and its derivatives as mucosal adjuvants, focusing on their safety, efficacy, and potential for clinical application.
results_summary: Chitosan-based adjuvants demonstrated strong mucosal adhesion, paracellular transport facilitation, good tolerability, and biocompatibility, showing promise for clinical use in enhancing immune responses.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article, not a clinical study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent knowledge about medicinal plants, including Chitosan, recommended for weight loss.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that Chitosan has been studied in clinical trials and its effects have been confirmed, but no specific results regarding its efficacy or safety are provided.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize current applications and future directions of chitosan coatings in drug delivery technologies.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan coatings offer advantages in drug delivery, including controlled release, slowed degradation, improved biocompatibility, targeted delivery, and stimulus-responsive release. It highlights chitosan's versatility in biomaterial delivery technologies.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the influence of chitosan biomaterial in stimulating platelet thrombogenicity cascades involving von Willebrand factor and other mediators in vWD patients.
results_summary: The study found that the oligo-group of chitosans (O-C) effectively triggered platelet thrombogenicity cascades, expediting blood coagulation processes, while the chemical composition of chitosan influenced its coagulation ability.
population_specificity: Fourteen vWD patients (predominantly type I).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate recent developments in phenolic compound delivery systems using chitosan as the main structural and functional material for antimicrobial activity against gastrointestinal pathogens.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan's antimicrobial properties and its ability to adhere to intestinal epithelium, suggesting its potential in developing nanoparticle-based antimicrobial therapies. It emphasizes chitosan's role in improving therapeutic index and controlled drug release.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on gastrointestinal pathogens in general).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the preparation methods and biomedical applications of chitin and chitosan nanofibers, focusing on their potential in tissue engineering, wound healing, and other medical uses.
results_summary: The study found that chitin and chitosan nanofibers have significant potential in various biomedical applications due to their high specific surface area and porosity, with promising results in tissue engineering, wound dressing, anti-cancer treatments, and other areas.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of chitosan derivatives, particularly photocrosslinked chitosan hydrogels (PCH), as submucosal fluid cushions (SFC) to improve endoscopic mucosal resection (EMR) and endoscopic submucosal dissection (ESD) for treating superficial gastrointestinal tumors.
results_summary: The study highlights that chitosan-based biomaterials, like PCH, show promise in facilitating ESD and EMR by providing high viscosity and hydrogelatinization properties, potentially improving resection rates for large lesions. However, complete resection of lesions >2 cm remains challenging, and ESD carries a higher perforation risk than EMR.
population_specificity: Patients with superficial lesions of the gastrointestinal tract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if locally delivered NSAIDs, specifically via chitosan sponges, could effectively prevent heterotopic ossification without negatively impacting wound healing.
results_summary: Chitosan sponges loaded with indomethacin showed improved wound healing (100% epithelial coverage at 28 days) and reduced inflammation compared to saline-chitosan and saline-gauze groups. The chitosan sponge itself (without NSAIDs) also performed better than saline-gauze, indicating potential benefits of chitosan in wound healing.
population_specificity: Rats with full-thickness wounds (20 per treatment group).
effective_dosage: Not specified for chitosan alone; indomethacin was tested at varying doses in vitro (0.0001 mM to 0.005 mM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the main adhesives and sealant materials, including Chitosan, for general surgery applications and highlight key aspects for future formulations.
results_summary: The abstract indicates Chitosan is among the important components for biological adhesives and sealants, with considerations for adhesion mechanisms, mechanical performance, and resistance to body fluids. However, specific efficacy results for Chitosan are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general surgery applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanisms of intracellular trafficking and transfection efficiency of hybrid gene delivery vectors combining retrovirus-like particles with chitosan (Chi/M-VLPs).
results_summary: The study found that Chi/M-VLPs used a combination of endocytic pathways for cellular internalization but were slower to transfect compared to liposome-based vectors (Lip/M-VLPs) due to delayed detachment of the synthetic component. The synthetic component significantly influenced intracellular transport and trafficking kinetics.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study, likely cell cultures).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review and discuss the potential of chitosan, chitooligosaccharides, and their derivatives in preventing and treating age-related dysfunctions.
results_summary: The study reviewed chitosan's role in addressing oxidative stress, LDL oxidation, tissue stiffness, protein conformational changes, and chronic inflammation associated with aging. It also examined chitosan-based functional foods for their therapeutic potential.
population_specificity: Elderly population with age-related, diet-related, and protein conformational diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a next-generation chitosan wound dressing in facilitating the healing of nonhealing chronic wounds compared to traditional vaseline gauze.
results_summary: The chitosan dressing significantly improved wound area reduction, reduced pain levels, and decreased wound depth compared to the control group, with no reported adverse events. The dressing was clinically safe and effective for chronic wound management.
population_specificity: 90 patients with unhealed chronic wounds (pressure ulcers, vascular ulcers, diabetic foot ulcers, and wounds with minor infections or at risk of infection).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review different vaccine delivery systems, including Chitosan, to assess their immunomodulatory effects in vaccine development.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that Chitosan, among other delivery systems, can elicit effective immune responses and improve vaccine stability and safety, though specific results for Chitosan alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of vaccine delivery systems).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review advances in growth factor delivery systems (GFDS) targeting the brain for Alzheimer's disease (AD) treatment, focusing on chitosan's role in protecting and sustainably delivering growth factors.
results_summary: The abstract discusses the potential of growth factors (GFs) in addressing AD hallmarks and highlights the need for delivery systems like chitosan to protect GFs and ensure sustainable brain delivery. It also addresses mechanistic challenges and mathematical frameworks for optimizing GF delivery.
population_specificity: Not specified (review paper, not a clinical study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent developments in chitosan-based pH-sensitive formulations for gastrointestinal drug delivery, focusing on their mechanisms and biomedical applications.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan-based formulations, such as nanoparticles and hydrogels, can achieve tailored pH-responsive drug release in the gastrointestinal tract, making them effective for disease diagnosis and therapy. These formulations respond to specific pH conditions in the stomach and intestine, enhancing targeted delivery.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of Chitosan and other polymers in dental applications, including alveolar ridge augmentation, bone grafts, and periodontal disease treatment.
results_summary: The abstract highlights Chitosan as a promising natural polymer for dental therapeutics, capable of being tailored for various properties, but does not provide specific efficacy data.
population_specificity: Not specified (general dental applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of chitosan-loaded electrospun nanofibers as an effective antibacterial drug delivery system for biomedical applications.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan, when incorporated into nanofibers, exhibits strong antibacterial activity and offers advantages such as controlled drug delivery, high loading capacity, and cost-effectiveness for applications like wound healing and tissue engineering.
population_specificity: Not specified (general biomedical applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the use of chitosan and other polymers for improving oral insulin delivery, focusing on bioavailability, safety, and long-term toxicity concerns.
results_summary: The abstract highlights chitosan as a promising polymer for insulin encapsulation, improving oral bioavailability, but notes a lack of long-term toxicity studies and no market-ready polymeric nanoparticle system yet.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of academic and industrial research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review synthesis strategies and therapeutic applications of polymer-coated gold nanoparticles (P-AuNPs), including chitosan, for cancer treatment.
results_summary: The abstract highlights chitosan as one of several biocompatible polymers used to enhance the stability, biocompatibility, and delivery efficiency of gold nanoparticles for cancer therapy, but no specific results on chitosan's effects are detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (review paper, not a clinical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of third-generation chitosan-based hemostatic agents and dressings in managing hemorrhage, particularly in cases where tourniquet placement is not feasible.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan-based hemostatic agents and dressings appear equally efficacious to those currently used by the US military for hemorrhage control, though clinical trial data is lacking, relying instead on anecdotal reports and laboratory studies. Efficacy of available agents has plateaued, but new developments may improve severe hemorrhage management.
population_specificity: Combat casualties and civilian trauma patients with truncal and junctional injuries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the properties and potential applications of preactivated thiomers, particularly thiolated chitosan, as advanced polymeric excipients in pharmaceuticals.
results_summary: The study found that preactivated thiomers, including thiolated chitosan, exhibit enhanced reactivity, stability against oxidation, and beneficial properties such as mucoadhesion, permeation enhancement, efflux pump inhibition, and in situ gelling, making them promising for various pharmaceutical formulations.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of preclinical and clinical research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of chitosan- and poloxamer-based thermogelling hydrogels for delivering PEGylated melphalan in breast cancer treatment.
results_summary: The chitosan-based hydrogel (MLP 5000) showed lower cumulative hydrolysis (1.67% after 6 hours) and reduced hemolytic activity (34.23% at 32 µg/ml) compared to the poloxamer-based hydrogel. It also demonstrated effective anticancer activity, though slightly less potent (13.12% cell viability at 150 µM) than the poloxamer-based system.
population_specificity: In vitro study (no human or animal subjects specified).
effective_dosage: 32 µg/ml for hemolysis testing; 150 µM for anticancer activity.
study_duration: Not specified (in vitro measurements taken at 1 and 6 hours).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of N-dihydro-galacto-chitosan (GC) as an immunoadjuvant in an in situ autologous cancer vaccine (inCVAX) strategy for treating metastatic cancers.
results_summary: The study reviewed the development of inCVAX, highlighting its potential to activate antigen-presenting cells and induce systemic tumor-specific T-cell responses through combined photothermal treatment and GC stimulation. The abstract suggests promising antitumor immune responses but does not provide detailed quantitative outcomes.
population_specificity: Metastatic cancer patients (specific cancer types not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current and potential wound healing treatments, including the use of chitosan-based dressings approved by the FDA.
results_summary: The abstract mentions chitosan as an FDA-approved material for wound dressings, indicating its established role in wound healing, but does not provide specific efficacy data for chitosan alone. New therapeutic interventions like growth factor delivery and stem cell therapy are highlighted as future directions.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of wound healing treatments).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of chitosan-based nanoparticles for improving the delivery and efficacy of psychiatric medications.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan nanoparticles enhance the bioavailability and stability of liposoluble active compounds, showing promise for treating behavior disorders with low cytotoxicity and high efficiency.
population_specificity: Not specified (general application for psychiatric medication delivery).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of Chitosan-based nanocarriers for delivering hydrophilic macromolecules and their suitability for skin and mucosal administration.
results_summary: Chitosan nanocarriers demonstrated mucoadhesion and protective capabilities for sensitive cargo like proteins and genetic materials, with promising safety for skin and mucosal routes, though further optimization is needed for clinical applications.
population_specificity: Not specified (general applicability to skin and mucosal administration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop chitosan-based nanoparticles for delivering midkine-siRNA as a potential gene therapy for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
results_summary: The study successfully synthesized MixNCH nanoparticles, which effectively condensed MK-siRNA, reduced MK mRNA levels significantly, and inhibited HepG2 cell proliferation in vitro. The nanoparticles showed comparable efficacy to Biotrans in gene knockdown.
population_specificity: In vitro study using HepG2 cells (a human hepatocellular carcinoma cell line).
effective_dosage: Weight ratio of 3 or above for MixNCH/MK-siRNA nanoparticles.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent progress and potential applications of glycol chitosan-based fluorescent theranostic nanoagents for cancer treatments and discuss their underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: Glycol chitosan-based nanoagents show great potential in cancer therapies, including chemotherapeutics, nucleic acid, and photodynamic therapies, by enabling simultaneous diagnosis and therapy. The review highlights their dual-purpose capabilities and enhanced therapeutic efficacy.
population_specificity: Cancer patients (theoretical application, not specified in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical safety and effectiveness of N,O-carboxymethyl chitosan as a pharmacological agent to prevent intraperitoneal adhesions after gynecological pelvic surgery.
results_summary: The study did not report any primary outcomes (pelvic pain, pregnancy, live birth rate, quality of life) for chitosan. Adverse events were not reported as an outcome in the studies involving chitosan.
population_specificity: Women undergoing gynecological pelvic surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate chitosan's mucoadhesive properties and its effectiveness in delivering siRNA across mucosal surfaces for respiratory and oral applications.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan-based polyplexes can facilitate siRNA delivery across mucosal barriers, leveraging chitosan's mucoadhesive properties. Preclinical applications showed promise for respiratory and oral delivery of siRNA.
population_specificity: Preclinical (not specified if human or animal models were used)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent developments in chitosan-based nanoparticles for tumor-targeted drug delivery, focusing on their preparation, properties, and applications in cancer therapy.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan-based nanoparticles show promise as drug-delivery carriers for cancer therapy due to their biodegradability, biocompatibility, high drug-carrying capacity, pH-dependent unloading, and prolonged circulating time. These properties help overcome limitations of conventional anti-cancer treatments.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article, not a clinical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of hydrophobically modified chitosan (HMC)-coated DPPC liposomes for improving Sorafenib delivery and tumor cell kill compared to other nanoparticle models.
results_summary: HMC-coated DPPC liposomes significantly improved Sorafenib's cytotoxicity, achieving 98% tumor cell kill at 15 μM over 96 h, outperforming both Sorafenib alone and PLGA nanoparticles. The HMC coating enhanced cell kill across all tested concentrations (5-15 μM) and time points (24-96 h).
population_specificity: Human metastatic clear cell renal cell carcinoma cell line (RCC 786-0).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide an overview of antimicrobial polymers, including Chitosan, their mechanisms of action, factors affecting activity, and applications in various fields.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that antimicrobial polymers, including Chitosan, show enhanced efficacy, reduced toxicity, and prolonged lifetime compared to small molecular counterparts, with applications in medical, hygienic, and industrial fields.
population_specificity: Not specified (broad overview of antimicrobial polymers)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the properties and effectiveness of glycol chitosan nanoparticles (GCNPs) for tumor-targeted drug delivery and imaging in cancer therapy.
results_summary: GCNPs demonstrated excellent tumor-homing efficacy due to prolonged blood circulation and enhanced permeability and retention effects, leading to improved therapeutic efficiency. The study highlighted their potential for both drug delivery and diagnostic imaging in cancer treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on in vitro and in vivo tumor-targeting properties).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent patents and investigations on chitosan/glycerophosphate (CS/Gp) hydrogels for their potential as tissue engineering scaffolds and drug delivery systems.
results_summary: The study found that CS/Gp hydrogels exhibit high biocompatibility, biodegradability, thermosensitive gelation, and minimal immune reactions, making them suitable for tissue engineering and controlled drug delivery. Additionally, they demonstrated good antibacterial properties and cell adhesion.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of patents and investigations, not a clinical trial).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effectiveness of marine polysaccharides, particularly chitosan, as low-cost adsorbents for wastewater treatment.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan as an effective and natural adsorbent for wastewater treatment, emphasizing its advantages over traditional methods. It positions chitosan as a promising, eco-friendly solution for improving water quality.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on wastewater treatment, not human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of marine carbohydrates, particularly chitosan, as nutraceutical and pharmaceutical agents with health benefits and low toxicity.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that chitosan and its derivatives from marine sources have significant applications in biology and biomedicine, demonstrating potential as therapeutic agents with medicinal value. However, specific efficacy data or clinical outcomes are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on marine-derived nutraceuticals)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the potential of chitosan and its derivatives as therapeutic agents for obesity and diabetes, focusing on their mechanisms and structure-based activity.
results_summary: The abstract highlights chitosan-based substances as promising lead molecules for treating and preventing obesity and diabetes, though detailed mechanisms remain unclear. Studies suggest chitosan and its derivatives could be valuable for developing natural therapeutic agents.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on obesity and diabetes applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the antioxidant activity of chitin, chitosan, and their derivatives, and their potential applications in food and pharmaceutical industries.
results_summary: The study found that chitin, chitosan, and their derivatives exhibit diverse beneficial activities, including antioxidant effects, which could be leveraged for therapeutic applications and functional food ingredients. The antioxidant activity was attributed to free radical-scavenging properties in vitro and in vivo.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review, not a clinical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate chitosan as a gene carrier in gene therapy, focusing on overcoming its limitations like low cell specificity and transfection efficiency.
results_summary: Chitosan shows promise as a gene carrier due to its biocompatibility and low toxicity but requires chemical modifications to improve cell specificity and transfection efficiency for clinical use.
population_specificity: Not specified (theoretical or in vitro/in vivo studies implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the efficacy and safety of 5-alpha reductase inhibitors (5αRIs) for androgenetic alopecia (AGA) and explore delivery systems like chitosan to optimize drug delivery and reduce systemic absorption.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about chitosan's effects, only mentioning its potential use in delivery systems for 5αRIs.
population_specificity: Not specified for chitosan.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of chitosan oligosaccharide (GO2KA1) supplementation on glucose control in subjects with prediabetes.
results_summary: The GO2KA1 intervention group showed significant decreases in serum glucose levels at 30 and 60 minutes, reduced HbA1c and pro-inflammatory cytokines (IL-6 and TNF-α), and increased plasma adiponectin after 12 weeks, while the placebo group showed no significant changes.
population_specificity: Subjects with prediabetes

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the adjuvant properties of chitosan in vaccines and highlight challenges in standardization and data availability for assessing immunogenicity and mechanisms of action.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan has been used in various forms and modifications as a vaccine adjuvant, but insufficient data exist to conclusively demonstrate immunogenicity or elucidate mechanisms of action. Standardization and detailed reporting of chitosan characteristics are lacking in most studies.
population_specificity: Preclinical and clinical studies (specific population not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate chitosan's potential as a carrier material for targeted drug delivery in treating neurodegenerative disorders, particularly Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: Chitosan demonstrates beneficial bioactivities on nerve cells and the blood-brain barrier, enhances nose-to-brain drug delivery success, and can be modified for improved permeation and brain targeting. It forms stable nanocomplexes suitable for delivering anti-Alzheimer drugs and siRNA.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on molecular and physiological effects, not human trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the use of chitosan-based nanoparticles and other drug delivery systems for transporting therapeutic agents across the blood-brain barrier (BBB) to treat neurological diseases.
results_summary: The abstract highlights chitosan-based nanomers as one of several effective nanoparticle systems for delivering drugs to the brain, emphasizing their potential in noninvasive CNS therapeutics, but does not provide specific efficacy data for chitosan alone.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of drug delivery systems, not a clinical study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent progress in the design, fabrication, and physicochemical aspects of chitosan-based self-assembled nanomaterials for drug delivery.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan's good biocompatibility, biodegradability, and low toxicity as a drug carrier, with self-assembled nanomaterials offering advantages over traditional fabrication methods. Applications in delivering various therapeutic agents are discussed in detail.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of ViscoGel, a chitosan-based hydrogel, in combination with a model vaccine (Act-HIB) in healthy volunteers.
results_summary: ViscoGel was found to be safe and well-tolerated, with no significant safety concerns. While it did not enhance anti-HIB antibody production, it increased interferon-γ (IFN-γ) responses in PBMCs and counteracted an inhibitory effect of Act-HIB vaccination on IFN-γ responses.
population_specificity: Healthy volunteers of both sexes, ages 22-50, not previously vaccinated against HIB.
effective_dosage: 25mg, 50mg, and 75mg of ViscoGel in Phase A; 50mg of ViscoGel combined with 0.2μg or 2μg Act-HIB in Phase B.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of alginate-based composites, including chitosan, for bone tissue engineering applications.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan-alginate composites enhance biochemical properties such as porosity, mechanical strength, cell adhesion, and osteogenic differentiation, making them promising for bone tissue regeneration.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or preclinical focus implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether Chitosan, as a nutraceutical, could regulate lipids and improve anthropometric parameters to minimize cardiovascular risk.
results_summary: The study found that Chitosan can regulate lipids and has benefits on anthropometric parameters, but larger prospective clinical trials are needed to confirm these effects.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of selenium nanoparticles with other selenocompounds (inorganic and organic selenospecies) on HepG2 cells to evaluate their potential as chemotherapeutic agents.
results_summary: The study found that selenium nanoparticles exhibited unique properties in terms of cell proliferation, apoptosis, and cell cycle patterns in HepG2 cells, supporting their potential future applications as chemotherapeutic agents. The results complemented prior evidence but did not directly compare efficacy to existing treatments.
population_specificity: HepG2 cells (a human liver cancer cell line)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop chitosan derivative polymeric micelles for co-delivery of paclitaxel and α-tocopherol succinate to improve therapeutic efficiency and reduce side effects of paclitaxel in cancer cells.
results_summary: The study found that α-TS/PTX-loaded micelles improved micelle stability, reduced size, sustained PTX release, and showed higher cytotoxicity against human ovarian cancer cells compared to PTX-loaded micelles and free drug solutions. The half maximal inhibitory concentration values indicated enhanced efficacy with α-TS modification.
population_specificity: Human ovarian cancer cell line (in vitro)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of N,O-carboxymethyl chitosan and other agents in preventing adhesions after gynaecological surgery.
results_summary: The study found that gels, including N,O-carboxymethyl chitosan, were effective in reducing adhesion formation and worsening adhesion scores compared to no treatment or hydroflotation agents, with high-quality evidence supporting these findings. However, no significant improvement in live birth rates or pelvic pain was observed.
population_specificity: Women undergoing gynaecological surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the improved mucoadhesive, enzyme-inhibiting, and permeation-enhancing properties of thiolated chitosan and its safety in human applications.
results_summary: Thiolated chitosan demonstrated significantly improved mucoadhesive properties, enzyme- and efflux-pump inhibition, and enhanced permeation. Safety was confirmed in human volunteers and clinical trials, with one product (Lacrimera®) approved for dry eye syndrome.
population_specificity: Human volunteers and clinical trial participants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of chitosan as a treatment for H. pylori infection, focusing on its antimicrobial properties and delivery systems.
results_summary: Chitosan has been investigated for its mucoadhesive and antimicrobial properties, showing promise in binding and scavenging H. pylori. It has been used in various forms, such as micro/nanoparticles and coatings, to enhance antibiotic delivery for gastric infections.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on H. pylori-infected individuals).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the tumor silencing efficiency of ternary complexes (chitosan, protamine, and shRNA) targeting VEGF and assess their gene delivery effectiveness.
results_summary: Ternary complexes showed higher VEGF silencing effects compared to binary complexes, with improved transgene expression and no cytotoxicity observed. Gene inhibition varied by cell line, with HEK293 showing the highest effect.
population_specificity: In vitro study using HeLa, HEK293, and MCF-7 cell lines.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of chitosan as a nanomaterial for enhancing nasal drug delivery, particularly for systemic and brain targeting of therapeutic agents.
results_summary: Chitosan was studied as part of nanotechnology-based systems for intranasal delivery, showing promising results in achieving therapeutic concentrations in the brain after nasal administration. The abstract highlights its role alongside other nanomaterials like carbon nanotubes and PLGA, but specific efficacy data for chitosan alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and in vivo studies referenced, but no human population details provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize the biological function of chitosanase CsnB in Aspergillus fumigatus and evaluate its potential as a diagnostic target for invasive aspergillosis.
results_summary: The study found that A. fumigatus grows on chitosan in a CsnB-dependent manner, with elevated CsnB production triggered by chitosan and tartrate. However, elevated antibody responses to CsnB and mitogillin did not correlate with galactomannan antigen assay results or clinical signs of fungal infections.
population_specificity: Patients at risk for invasive aspergillosis (severely immunocompromised individuals).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if chitosan/β-glycerophosphate (chitosan/ß-GP) could improve acute retention and engraftment of human mesenchymal stem cells (hMSCs) in a rat myocardial infarct model compared to saline control.
results_summary: Chitosan/ß-GP significantly improved cell retention, showing a 14-fold increase compared to saline control, with 50-60% of cells retained at 24 hours post-implantation. Immunohistochemical analysis qualitatively confirmed these findings.
population_specificity: Rat myocardial infarct model (n = 7-8 per group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the soothing effect of a cream containing hydroxypropyl chitosan on stinging and burning sensations in patients with erythemato-telangiectatic rosacea.
results_summary: The cream reduced stinging and burning sensations by 56.1%, with no reported side effects. The mean score per patient decreased from 2.2 to 1.2 points over 12 weeks.
population_specificity: 37 adult Caucasian patients (9 males, 28 females) with erythemato-telangiectatic rosacea.
effective_dosage: 1% hydroxypropyl chitosan in a cream applied twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of hydrophobically modified glycol chitosan nanoparticles (CNPs) for multimodal imaging and targeted drug delivery in disease-specific theranostics.
results_summary: CNPs demonstrated excellent physiochemical and biological properties, enabling successful encapsulation and delivery of various imaging agents and therapeutic drugs (chemo-drugs, nucleotides, peptides, photodynamic chemicals) to targeted diseases in vivo. The study highlights CNPs' potential as an efficient theranostic system for early diagnosis and personalized medicine.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vivo conditions mentioned, but no human or animal specifics provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of third-generation hemostatic dressings, particularly chitosan-based products like Celox Gauze and ChitoGauze, in preclinical and clinical settings.
results_summary: Chitosan-based dressings demonstrated equal efficacy to Combat Gauze and function independently of physiological clotting mechanisms. Long-term safety was reported with no complications or side effects in military use.
population_specificity: Military personnel (Operation Enduring Freedom and Operation Iraqi Freedom) and prehospital/clinical settings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of carboxymethyl chitosan (CMCS) as a biopolymer for drug delivery systems and tissue engineering applications in regenerative medicine.
results_summary: The study found that CMCS exhibits excellent biocompatibility, enhanced aqueous solubility, and strong bioactivity, making it suitable for drug delivery and tissue engineering. It can load hydrophobic drugs and has applications in targeted drug delivery and tissue regeneration across various organs.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article, not a clinical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of chitosan-GPTMS porous hybrid membranes for enhancing peripheral nerve regeneration in rat models.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan-GPTMS porous hybrid membranes significantly improved nerve fiber regeneration and functional recovery in rat models of sciatic nerve injuries, with increased myelinated nerve fibers and myelin thickness, both with and without mesenchymal stem cells.
population_specificity: Rat models with axonotmetic and neurotmetic sciatic nerve injuries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of agro-industrial byproducts, including chitosan, as sustainable materials for developing novel drug delivery systems (DDS) with high biocompatibility and low toxicity.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that chitosan and other byproducts offer advantages such as high biocompatibility, biodegradability, and low systemic toxicity, making them promising for DDS applications in treating pathologies like cancer and diabetes. The study emphasizes the sustainable and cost-effective potential of these materials in nanobiotechnology.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the therapeutic properties of marine glycans, including chitosan, focusing on their structural and functional benefits in medical applications.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan, among other marine glycans, exhibits broad medical actions, including beneficial effects in inflammation, coagulation, thrombosis, cancer growth/metastasis, and vascular biology when specific structural requirements are met.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of marine glycans in general).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of chitosan amphiphile nanoparticles for noninvasive oral delivery of therapeutic peptides across the blood-brain barrier.
results_summary: The study highlighted chitosan amphiphile nanoparticles as a promising method for oral peptide delivery, emphasizing their uptake by the gastrointestinal epithelium and their role in protecting peptides from plasma degradation.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on peptide delivery for neurological diseases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate chitosan as a candidate for injectable scaffolds in regenerative medicine, focusing on its gelation stimuli and applications in bone, cartilage, cardiovascular, and neural regeneration.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan is widely investigated for injectable scaffolds due to its desirable physicochemical properties, with 27% of injectable scaffold publications in the past decade focusing on chitosan. However, despite extensive exploration, few chitosan-based scaffolds have progressed to clinical trials, highlighting barriers to clinical translatability.
population_specificity: Not specified (broad focus on regenerative medicine applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the hemostatic efficacy and radial artery occlusion outcomes of a chitosan-based pad versus a radial compression device after transradial coronary intervention.
results_summary: The chitosan-based pad significantly reduced compression time, had lower rates of errhysis (7% vs. 20%), and showed lower incidences of both early (5.4% vs. 11.7%) and chronic (5% vs. 10%) radial artery occlusion compared to the compression device.
population_specificity: 600 patients who underwent transradial coronary intervention.
effective_dosage: Not specified (chitosan-based pad applied as needed for hemostasis).
study_duration: Follow-up at 24 hours and 30 days post-intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate chitosan and its derivatives as nasal absorption enhancers for various drugs and formulations, including their potential to improve drug transport from the nasal cavity to the brain.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan and its derivatives effectively improve nasal bioavailability and that chitosan nanoparticles significantly enhance drug transport from the nose to the brain compared to simpler chitosan formulations. The review also questioned whether nanoparticles offer substantial advantages over basic chitosan formulations.
population_specificity: Not specified (general evaluation of chitosan's effects in nasal drug delivery).

study_goal: The researchers reviewed the potential of Chitosan-based carriers as an alternative for limbal stem cell transplantation in treating severe ocular surface disorders.
results_summary: The abstract mentions gelatin-chitosan as an emerging alternative carrier material for limbal stem cell transplantation, but no specific results regarding its efficacy or safety are provided.
population_specificity: Patients with severe ocular surface disorders and limbal stem cell deficiency.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of chitosan as a scaffolding matrix in tissue engineering-based strategies for articular cartilage restoration.
results_summary: The study identified chitosan as one of the carbohydrate-based scaffolds investigated for articular cartilage tissue engineering, alongside other materials like collagen and synthetic polymers. It highlighted the importance of scaffolds in supporting mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) for chondrogenesis but did not provide specific efficacy data for chitosan alone.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on in vitro or preclinical applications implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate chitosan-alginate and chitosan-pectin polyelectrolyte complex films as prolonged drug release devices for tetracycline HCl in treating periodontal pockets.
results_summary: The films demonstrated burst drug release followed by prolonged release over 70 hours, maintained antibacterial activity against Staphylococcus aureus for 21 days, and significantly reduced periodontal pocket depth in clinical evaluation.
population_specificity: Patients with periodontal pockets (specific details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the development of chemical methods, including chitosan, for gene transfer in vitro and in vivo.
results_summary: The abstract summarizes chitosan as one of the cationic polymers used in chemical gene transfer methods, highlighting its role in gene delivery applications. No specific results on chitosan's performance are detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of in vitro and in vivo studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety and performance of the BioWeld1 system for skin closure in cesarean section patients.
results_summary: The study found no device-related adverse events, full epidermal closure, very low scar scores, and no significant complications like discharge, redness, or edema. The BioWeld1 system was deemed safe and effective for skin closure.
population_specificity: 20 patients scheduled for elective cesarean section.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to critically evaluate the permeation enhancement effects and cell viability of chitosan and TMC in intestinal and airway models, as well as assess synthetic strategies for TMC.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan and TMC enhance permeation through mucosal membranes, but discrepancies in results can be attributed to differences in polymer structure, experimental conditions, and in vitro models. Recommendations were provided to improve understanding of structure-activity relationships and mechanisms of action.
population_specificity: Intestinal and airway epithelial models (in vitro and in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the erosion/abrasion-preventing potential of an experimental toothpaste containing chitosan, comparing its effects to other fluoride formulations and placebo.
results_summary: The AmF/NaF/SnCl2/chitosan formulation significantly reduced tissue loss by 20-25% compared to placebo, except when applied without brushing in the absence of the organic matrix. The effects were similar regardless of the presence or absence of the organic matrix.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study using dentine samples)
effective_dosage: 0.5% chitosan in toothpaste slurry, applied 2 × 2 min/day

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the permeation and penetration of amorolfine (Loceryl®) and ciclopirox (Onytec®), formulated with hydroxypropyl chitosan (HPCH), through human nails, and evaluate their efficacy against nail pathogens.
results_summary: The HPCH-based CPX formulation (Onytec®) demonstrated superior penetration and permeation through human nails compared to the MRF formulation (Loceryl®), with higher efficacy against common nail pathogens.
population_specificity: Human healthy nails (in vitro study)
effective_dosage: 8% CPX in HPCH-based formulation (Onytec®), 5% MRF in anhydrous formulation (Loceryl®)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic efficacy of chitosan nanoparticles for codelivering siRNA-expressing plasmid targeting VEGF and IL-4-expressing plasmid in breast cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study found that codelivery of psiVEGF and pIL-4 plasmids in chitosan nanoparticles significantly enhanced gene-silencing efficiency (81% in vitro, 97% tumor growth inhibition in vivo) compared to single-plasmid treatments.
population_specificity: Breast tumor model (rats)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the use of chitosan/hyaluronic acid polyelectrolyte complex (PEC) hydrogels for wound and burn healing.
results_summary: The study found that PEC hydrogels enhance antimicrobial activity, promote wound healing, and prevent wound damage during treatment due to the combined properties of chitosan and hyaluronic acid.
population_specificity: Not specified (general application for wound and burn healing).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and immune-stimulating efficacy of chitosan, particularly chitosan salts, as an adjuvant for nasal vaccines.
results_summary: Chitosan demonstrated good tolerability, excellent immune stimulation, and positive clinical results in preclinical and clinical studies, including robust immunological responses and protective immunity against norovirus when combined with monophosphoryl lipid.
population_specificity: Preclinical and clinical study participants, including those in investigations on a norovirus vaccine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the biocompatibility and suitability of chitosan, among other polymers, for producing immunoprotective capsules for therapeutic cell encapsulation.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about chitosan's effects but notes that drawing conclusions about the most adequate polymer for clinical application is difficult due to insufficient documentation on critical factors like toxicity and permeability. Only alginate has been extensively studied and currently qualifies for application.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of polymers for therapeutic cell encapsulation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of polymeric carriers, including chitosan, as vaccine delivery systems, focusing on their properties and effectiveness.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan as a biocompatible, biodegradable, and non-toxic polymeric carrier that enhances stability and protection during cellular trafficking, making it effective for vaccine delivery. It also notes chitosan's adjuvant effects in vaccine delivery due to its uptake by antigen-presenting cells.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of general polymeric carriers).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate chitosan's potential as a biomaterial for neural repair, both in vitro and in vivo, and its suitability for clinical applications.
results_summary: Chitosan demonstrated biomimetic properties in neuronal and glial cell cultures and promoted neural regeneration in both central and peripheral nervous systems in vivo. The promising results suggest chitosan-based devices may soon be ready for clinical trials.
population_specificity: Neuronal and glial cell cultures, and in vivo models of nervous system repair.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of chitosan as a non-viral delivery system for RNA interference (RNAi) mediators in therapeutic applications.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that chitosan, among other cationic polymers, is a promising candidate for in vivo delivery of double-stranded RNAs, addressing challenges like degradation and inefficient cellular uptake. However, specific efficacy data on chitosan's performance are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of RNAi delivery systems).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of ChitoHem tampon (reinforced with chitosan) against other topical hemostatic agents in stopping epistaxis in patients with inherited bleeding disorders.
results_summary: ChitoHem tampon was significantly more efficient than Tranexamic acid impregnated tampon (P < 0.001) and EpiCell tampon (P < 0.05) in achieving hemostasis. The study concluded that ChitoHem tampon was the best therapy solution for stopping epistaxis in this population.
population_specificity: Patients with inherited bleeding disorders (e.g., Glanzmann disease, von-Willebrand disease, Bernard-Soulier syndrome, activated factor VII deficiency, impaired adenosine deaminase secretion), mean age 5.6 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the targeting potential of chitosan-functionalized PLGA micro- and nanoparticles to inflamed intestinal mucosa compared to healthy mucosa in IBD patients.
results_summary: Chitosan-functionalized particles adhered to tissue surfaces, showing the lowest translocation and deposition in both healthy and inflamed tissues compared to non-functionalized and PEG-functionalized particles.
population_specificity: Patients with inflammatory bowel disease (Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis) and healthy controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of chitosan-silicate hybrid biomaterials, in combination with mesenchymal stem cells, for nerve regeneration in rat sciatic nerve injuries.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan-silicate hybrid biomaterials, when associated with mesenchymal stem cells, showed promise in nerve regeneration, as assessed through functional analysis and morphological evaluation in rat models of axonotmesis and neurotmesis lesions.
population_specificity: Rat models with sciatic nerve injuries (axonotmesis and neurotmesis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate current and potential future strategies, including chitosan coatings, for reducing pin site infections in external fixators.
results_summary: The abstract mentions chitosan coatings as a potential strategy for preventing pin site infections but does not provide specific results regarding its effectiveness. It highlights the need for further studies to assess cytotoxicity and osteointegration prevention.
population_specificity: Patients with external fixator pins at risk of infection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of chitosan-based nanoparticles for delivering FGF2 in pre-clinical animal models as a therapeutic strategy for neurodegenerative disorders.
results_summary: The abstract highlights chitosan-based nanoparticles as a novel delivery method for FGF2, suggesting their potential in therapeutic interventions for neurodegenerative diseases, though specific efficacy data is not detailed.
population_specificity: Pre-clinical animal models (not specified further).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of BST-CarGel, a chitosan-based medical device, compared to microfracture alone in repairing cartilage lesions in the knee.
results_summary: BST-CarGel treatment resulted in superior lesion filling and repair tissue quality compared to microfracture alone, with equivalent clinical benefits and safety profiles between the two groups.
population_specificity: 80 patients aged 18-55 with a single, symptomatic focal lesion on the femoral condyles.
effective_dosage: Not specified (BST-CarGel mixed with autologous whole blood).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of chitosan as a delivery system for siRNA, identifying barriers to efficiency and discussing solutions to improve its performance.
results_summary: Chitosan effectively forms nanoparticles with siRNA due to its cationic nature and shows promise for in vivo delivery, but requires further development to enhance stability and endosomal escape. Recent improvements have addressed previous pitfalls, paving the way for advanced siRNA delivery systems.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article, not a clinical study).

study_goal: The researchers reviewed the use of carbon nanotubes (CNTs) as drug delivery systems, focusing on their efficacy and complications in delivering small molecule drugs.
results_summary: The abstract highlights CNTs' potential as nanocarriers due to their high surface area, cellular uptake, and ability to conjugate with therapeutics, showing superior efficacy and reduced side effects. It also notes emerging applications beyond cancer treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and in vivo research mentioned)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how chitosan-containing nanoparticles (chitosan NPs) can overcome microbial drug resistance by using multiple mechanisms simultaneously.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan NPs, along with other nanoparticles, can combat microbes through multiple mechanisms, making resistance unlikely. They can overcome existing resistance mechanisms like decreased drug uptake, increased efflux, biofilm formation, and intracellular bacteria, and can target antimicrobial agents to infection sites.
population_specificity: Not specified (general microbial resistance context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the development, preparation strategies, and expanding applications of lipid-polymer hybrid nanoparticles (LPNs), including their potential for clinical use.
results_summary: The study found that LPNs exhibit superior in vivo cellular delivery efficacy compared to polymeric nanoparticles and liposomes, with advancements in preparation methods (from two-step to one-step) and broader applications (e.g., drug delivery, genetic materials, vaccines, diagnostics).
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-erosive and anti-abrasive efficacy of a toothpaste combining fluoride, tin, and chitosan compared to a fluoride-only toothpaste and placebo.
results_summary: The F/Sn/chitosan toothpaste significantly reduced tissue loss (52.5% ± 30.9% without brushing, 50.2% ± 34.3% with brushing) compared to the NaF toothpaste (19.0% ± 47.3% without brushing, 21.3% ± 22.4% with brushing) and placebo, demonstrating superior efficacy against erosive and erosive-abrasive damage.
population_specificity: 27 volunteers in a randomized, double-blind, three-cell crossover in situ trial.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of nanotechnology-based drug delivery systems, including Chitosan, to improve therapeutic outcomes for respiratory infections and drug resistance.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the challenges in pulmonary drug delivery and the promise of nano-DDS to overcome these limitations, but specific findings on Chitosan's effects are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on respiratory infections, including TB and hospital-acquired infections in immune-compromised patients).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent advances in chitosan-based transfection for gene therapy, focusing on improving its efficiency and understanding its structure-performance relationship.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan's biocompatibility and low immunogenicity but notes its relatively low transfection efficiency compared to viral vectors. Recent progress in structural tailoring has improved its performance.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate chitosan's potential as an LPS-binding and endotoxin-neutralizing agent for treating endotoxemic complications like sepsis and endotoxic shock.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan has potential as an antiendotoxin agent, with hydrophobic derivatives increasing its binding affinity to LPS. Animal model data supported its potency in neutralizing endotoxins.
population_specificity: Animal models (specific species not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the basics of mucoadhesion, including the mechanism of bioadhesion and the polymers (such as Chitosan) used in bioadhesive drug delivery systems.
results_summary: The study highlighted that mucoadhesive polymers like Chitosan can enhance local therapeutic activity and systemic drug availability by increasing residence time at the application site. However, specific efficacy data on Chitosan were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of mucoadhesive systems).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the advantages and deficiencies of various hemodialysis membranes, including chitosan, in improving biocompatibility and solute removal.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about chitosan's effects but mentions it as one of the synthetic membranes evaluated for hemodialysis applications.
population_specificity: Patients with acute or chronic renal failure undergoing hemodialysis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of chitosan as an active ingredient in toothpaste formulations to increase the acid resistance of tooth surfaces or pellicles, alongside other substances like fluoride and polyvalent metal cations.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that chitosan, among other substances, shows potential for developing effective anti-erosion toothpastes, but current evidence is limited by diverse experimental designs and lacks clinical studies. The combined action of active ingredients and abrasives in toothpaste formulations is not yet fully understood.
population_specificity: Not specified (general dental erosion context, with mention of younger age groups in some countries).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the use of polysaccharides, including Chitosan, in designing nanocarriers for nucleic acid delivery and their potential benefits in improving delivery efficiency.
results_summary: The abstract summarizes recent progress in polysaccharide-assisted nucleic acid delivery, highlighting the benefits of polysaccharides like Chitosan in overcoming delivery barriers but does not provide specific results on Chitosan's efficacy or safety.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to critically discuss chitosan's potential as a gene delivery vector, particularly in orthopedic tissue engineering.
results_summary: Chitosan is biodegradable, biocompatible, and non-toxic, making it a promising candidate for non-viral gene delivery and tissue engineering. It has demonstrated transfection capabilities in various cell types and enhances mineral deposition during osteogenic differentiation.
population_specificity: Human embryonic kidney cells (HEK293) and human cervical cancer cells (HeLa) were studied in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review various approaches for effective protein/peptide drug delivery, with a focus on the potential of chitosan and other biodegradable polymers in this context.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that chitosan and modified chitosan nanoparticles show great potential in delivering protein/peptide drugs, alongside other systems like liposomes and hydrogels. It also mentions PEGylation as a method to enhance protein stability and pharmacokinetics.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent developments and applications of chitosan-based nanomaterials, particularly in biomedical fields such as drug delivery, regenerative medicine, and disease treatment.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan's biocompatibility, biodegradability, and non-toxic properties, along with enhanced physical and chemical characteristics in nanomaterial form, making it promising for drug delivery, gene delivery, and disease diagnosis.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of chitosan-based hemostatic dressings in controlling external bleeding episodes in patients with severe bleeding disorders, including pediatric cases.
results_summary: The chitosan-based dressing successfully controlled bleeding in 4 out of 6 episodes, eliminating the need for systemic therapy in those cases. No adverse events, rebleeding, or local skin reactions were reported.
population_specificity: Pediatric and adult patients with severe bleeding disorders (median age 2 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the transfection efficiency and therapeutic activity of chitosan nanoparticles and cationic liposomes for siRNA delivery in mammalian cells.
results_summary: Chitosan nanoparticles achieved ~57% suppression of the targeted gene (GFP), indicating effective siRNA delivery, though cationic liposomes performed better (~70% suppression). Both carriers showed potential for siRNA transfection.
population_specificity: HEK 293 mammalian cell line

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic response of hydroxypropyl chitosan in treating pterygium inversum unguis.
results_summary: The study reported a good therapeutic response to hydroxypropyl chitosan in a case of pterygium inversum unguis, contrasting with poor responses to other topical therapies like keratolytics and corticosteroids.
population_specificity: A patient with pterygium inversum unguis, likely associated with collagen diseases such as systemic lupus erythematosus or scleroderma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the potential of poloxamer 407/chitosan lactate (PLX/CS-L) and chitosan lactate/glycerophosphate (CS-L/GP) mixtures as mucoadhesive, thermally sensitive vehicles for treating vaginal mucositis.
results_summary: The CS-L/GP mixture showed stronger mucoadhesion and better bioactive properties (antimicrobial and wound healing) compared to the PLX/CS-L mixture, leading to prolonged drug contact with the biological substrate. The CS-L/GP mixture also maintained its gelation properties better under dilution with simulated vaginal fluid.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or ex vivo study implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the adjuvant properties of chitin, chitosan, and their derivatives in cancer vaccines and discuss future development trends.
results_summary: The study highlighted the advantages of chitin and chitosan as adjuvants for cancer vaccines, with specific focus on glycated chitosan and chitosan nanoparticles, indicating their potential for future applications in immunotherapy.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of adjuvant properties).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the use of chitosan and other materials in developing photo-based nanoparticles for diagnostic and therapeutic applications.
results_summary: The abstract highlights chitosan as one of the polymer-based materials used in photo-based nanoparticles for applications like imaging and drug delivery, but it does not provide specific findings on chitosan's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of nanomaterials)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the use of chitosan as a natural polymer in biomaterials for periodontal tissue regeneration, focusing on its role in guided tissue regeneration (GTR) and scaffold applications.
results_summary: Chitosan is highlighted as a natural polymer used in periodontal treatment, functioning as a barrier material in GTR to prevent epithelial downgrowth and promote repopulation of periodontal ligament and alveolar bone cells. The abstract suggests chitosan is effective in combination with other materials to address membrane collapse issues in GTR.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on periodontal disease treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and properties of chitosan and calcium phosphate composites for hard tissue regeneration in musculoskeletal disorders.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan and calcium phosphate composites as biocompatible, biofunctional, and non-antigenic materials, making them ideal for hard tissue regeneration. These biomaterials show promise for treating musculoskeletal disorders due to their excellent properties.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on orthopedic applications)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether replacing traditional NaCl with Symbiosal (NaCl + chitosan 3%) could improve blood pressure control in patients with mild hypertension.
results_summary: Symbiosal significantly reduced systolic and diastolic blood pressure compared to traditional NaCl, with a higher proportion of patients achieving controlled blood pressure. The effects were statistically significant and confirmed in crossover analysis.
population_specificity: 40 patients with mild, untreated hypertension.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of injectable polymeric biomaterial scaffolds, including chitosan, for bone tissue regeneration.
results_summary: The study highlighted chitosan as a promising material for injectable microspheres in bone tissue regeneration, focusing on its biodegradation, biocompatibility, and other material properties. It suggested that chitosan, combined with cells, has significant potential for treating orthopedic bone defects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of biomaterials for bone tissue regeneration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether chitosan enhances the anti-erosive/anti-abrasive effects of Sn(2+)-containing toothpastes in an in situ study.
results_summary: Chitosan significantly improved the efficacy of the Sn(2+)-containing toothpaste in reducing tissue loss, particularly when combined with brushing, compared to the placebo and the Sn(2+)-only toothpaste. The F/Sn/chitosan group showed comparable effectiveness to the positive control (GelKam).
population_specificity: Ten subjects wearing mandibular appliances with human enamel specimens.
effective_dosage: 0.5% chitosan in toothpaste suspension, applied 2×2 min/day.
study_duration: 7 days of demineralization followed by intraoral exposure to toothpaste suspensions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate chitosan nanoparticles containing aminolevulinic acid derivatives for enhancing the efficacy of Photodynamic Therapy and electrochemotherapy in treating skin cancer.
results_summary: The study developed chitosan nanoparticles with 5-ALA and 8-ALA, demonstrating in vitro cytotoxic activity and suggesting a synergistic effect when combined with Photodynamic Therapy and electrochemotherapy for improved skin permeation and treatment efficiency.
population_specificity: In vitro study (no human or animal subjects specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of chitosan-based nanoparticles in topical drug delivery for treating dermatological diseases.
